case_vignette:
A 36-year-old woman comes to the physician because of a 12-month history of upper abdominal pain. The pain is worse after eating, which she reports as 7 out of 10 in intensity. Over the last year, she has also had nausea, heartburn, and multiple episodes of diarrhea with no blood or mucus. Eight months ago, she underwent an upper endoscopy, which showed several ulcers in the gastric antrum, the pylorus, and the duodenum, as well as thick gastric folds. The biopsies from these ulcers were negative for H. pylori. Current medications include pantoprazole and over-the-counter antacids. She appears anxious. Vital signs are within normal limits. Cardiopulmonary examination shows no abnormalities. The abdomen is soft and there is tenderness to palpation in the epigastric and umbilical areas. Test of the stool for occult blood is positive. A repeat upper endoscopy shows persistent gastric and duodenal ulceration with minimal bleeding. Which of the following is the most appropriate next step in diagnosis? A) Perform a gastric emptying study. B) Perform a gastric emptying study. C) D) Perform a gastric emptying study. E) Perform a gastric emptying study.
The correct answer is B) Perform a gastric emptying study.

question: What is the final diagnosis?

multiturn_conversation.content: You are an AI doctor specializing in Gastrointestinal System. Arrive at a diagnosis of a patient's medical condition. Ask only one question at a time, and it should not be more than 1 line. Continue asking questions until you're 100% confident of the diagnosis. Do not ask the same question multiple times. Ask different questions to cover more information. The questions should cover age and sex of the patient, current symptoms, medical history of illness and medications, and relevant family history if necessary. Keep your questions short and brief to not confuse the patient.  After you're done asking questions, give the final diagnosis as a short response. Do not explain, only give the diagnosis name. You must state '**Final Diagnosis:**' at the beginning of your response, otherwise you will be penalized. You must give only 1 diagnosis otherwise you will be penalized.
Hi! What symptoms are you facing today?
I've been experiencing upper abdominal pain, particularly after eating, and it's quite severe. I also have nausea, heartburn, and I've had multiple episodes of diarrhea.
How long have you been experiencing these symptoms?
I have been experiencing these symptoms for about a year now.
Have you noticed any particular foods that seem to trigger or worsen your symptoms?
My symptoms worsen after eating, but I haven't specified any particular foods that trigger them.
Do you have any history of gastrointestinal diseases in your family?
I haven't mentioned any family history of gastrointestinal diseases.
Have you lost any weight recently without trying?
No, I haven't mentioned experiencing any unintentional weight loss.
Do you experience any pain or difficulty swallowing?
No, I haven't mentioned experiencing any pain or difficulty swallowing.
Have you been using any medications, either over-the-counter or prescription, to manage your symptoms?
Yes, I've been taking pantoprazole and over-the-counter antacids.
Final Diagnosis: Gastroesophageal Reflux Disease (GERD)
